name: Playa Atacames
address: Malecón de Atacames, Cantón Atacames, Esmeraldas
description: The province’s busiest beach: 5 km of sand, water sports and vibrant nightlife.

name: Playa Tonsupa
address: Av. Club del Pacífico, Tonsupa, Esmeraldas
description: Calm waves, family‑friendly resorts and perfect sunsets; humpback whales from June to September.

name: Súa
description: Fishing village with gentle waters, seafood huts and access to the Peñón del Suicida and Cueva del Amor.

name: Playa Same
description: Five kilometres of fine sand, Club Casablanca and cuisine rich in seafood and coconut.

name: Isla Muisne
description: Tropical island surrounded by mangroves and bird refuges; famous for encocados and ceviches.

name: Mompiche
description: Former fishing village—now home to the Decameron resort; white sand and crystal‑clear surf breaks.

name: Playa Escondida
description: Private 100‑ha reserve with cliffs, primary rainforest and wildlife such as anteaters.

name: Playa Las Palmas
address: Malecón Las Palmas, Ciudad de Esmeraldas
description: Urban beach with a 5‑km shoreline, beach bars and the Afro Music & Dance Festival at carnival.

name: Las Peñas
description: Quiet fishing village, mysterious sea caves and Pelican Island—ideal for seabird watching.

name: Isla La Tolita Pampa de Oro
address: Mouth of the Santiago River, Cantón La Tola, Esmeraldas
description: Archaeological park of the La Tolita culture (500 BC–AD 50) with site museum and nature trails.
